#define N_UTIL_ROM

CPU-architecture dependent storage modifier to indicate the constant should be in ROM

#define N_UTIL_ARRAY_SIZE (   ar)    (sizeof(ar)/sizeof(*(ar)))

Macro to get (at compile-time) the number of elements in an array.

Parameters:
arThe array to get the size of (not a pointer)

Definition at line 78 of file N_Util.h.

#define N_UTIL_COMPILE_ASSERT (   condition)    static char* dummy##__LINE__ = ((!!(condition)) - 1); (void)dummy##__LINE__

Macro to check a condition during compile time.

Parameters:
conditionThe condition that needs to be valid at compile time.
Note:
If the condition is false at compile time, the compiler will generate an error that a pointer is initialized with -1.

Definition at line 87 of file N_Util.h.

#define N_UTIL_BOOL (   x)    ((x) ? TRUE : FALSE)

Convert a boolean expression (which has type int) to a bool.

This is to keep lint happy if the bool type is a 8 bit unsigned integer instead of a native int.

Definition at line 103 of file N_Util.h.

#define N_UTIL_PORT_CLEAR (   port,
  mask 
)    N_UTIL_SWALLOW_SEMICOLON( (port) &= ~(mask); )

Macro to clear a mask, typically of an I/O port

Parameters:
portThe port to clear the mask in
maskA mask. The bits set in the mask will be cleared in the port

Definition at line 109 of file N_Util.h.

#define N_UTIL_PORT_SET (   port,
  mask 
)    N_UTIL_SWALLOW_SEMICOLON( (port) |= (mask); )

Macro to set a mask, typically of an I/O port

Parameters:
portThe port to set bits in
maskA mask. The bits set in the mask will be cleared in the port

Definition at line 115 of file N_Util.h.

#define N_UTIL_PORT_WRITEBITS (   port,
  mask,
  value 
)    N_UTIL_SWALLOW_SEMICOLON( (port) = ((port) & (~(mask))) | ((value) & (mask)); )

Macro to set the bits from value that are set in mask

Parameters:
portThe port to write to
maskA mask that indicates what bits in the port to change
valueThe bits to write to the port. Only the bits of value that are also in mask have any effect.

Definition at line 147 of file N_Util.h.

#define N_UTIL_CALLBACK_DECLARE (   callbackType,
  subscribersArray,
  numSubscribers 
)
Value:
static const callbackType* subscribersArray[/*lint -e(506) */ numSubscribers?numSubscribers:1u] = { NULL }; \
    static const uint8_t N_UTIL_CONCAT(subscribersArray,_size) = numSubscribers

Declare administration for the N_UTIL_CALLBACK macros

Note:
The _size variable is optimized away by the compiler.
The subscribersArray cannot be 0-size, but for the 0-subscriber case everything is optimized away anyway.

Definition at line 154 of file N_Util.h.

#define N_UTIL_CALLBACK_SUBSCRIBE (   callbackType,
  subscribersArray,
  pNewCb 
)
Value:
N_UTIL_SWALLOW_SEMICOLON( \
        /*lint -e{506} */ \
        N_ERRH_ASSERT_FATAL(N_UTIL_CONCAT(subscribersArray,_size) != 0u); \
        uint8_t i=(uint8_t)N_UTIL_CONCAT(subscribersArray,_size) - 1u; \
        do { \
            if (subscribersArray[i] == NULL) \
            { \
                subscribersArray[i] = pNewCb; \
                break; \
            } \
            N_ERRH_ASSERT_FATAL(i != 0u); \
            i--; \
        } while(/*lint -e(506) */ 1); \
    )

Standard implementation of a Subscribe function.

Parameters:
callbackTypeType of the callback interface structure
subscribersArrayArray with subscribers
pNewCbPointer to add to subscribersArray

Definition at line 163 of file N_Util.h.

#define N_UTIL_CALLBACK_STATEMENT (   callbackType,
  subscribersArray,
  statement,
  member,
  arguments 
)
Value:
N_UTIL_SWALLOW_SEMICOLON( \
        /*lint -e{506} */ \
        if (N_UTIL_CONCAT(subscribersArray,_size) != 0u) \
        { \
            uint8_t i_ = (uint8_t)N_UTIL_CONCAT(subscribersArray,_size) - 1u; \
            do { \
                if ((subscribersArray[i_]) != NULL) \
                { \
                    if (subscribersArray[i_]->member != NULL) \
                    { \
                        statement subscribersArray[i_]->member arguments; \
                    } \
                } \
                if (i_ == 0u) \
                { \
                    break; \
                } \
                i_--; \
            } while (/*lint -e(506) */ 1); \
        } \
    )

Finds the first active subscriber, calls it and executes a statement

Parameters:
callbackTypeType of the callback interface structure
subscribersArrayArray with subscribers
statementStatement to do for each subscriber, e.g. "i ="
memberCallback function to do
argumentsParentised list of arguments suitable for member

static uint8_t N_Util_BreakUint32 ( uint32_t  var,
uint8_t  byteIndex 
) [inline, static]

Takes a byte out of a uint32_t

Parameters:
varThe 32-bit integer to break up
byteIndexThe byte (0..3) to return. 0 for the LS byte, 3 for the MS byte.

Reset the system

uint8_t N_Util_HighestNetworkUpdateId ( uint8_t  id1,
uint8_t  id2 
)

Return the highest network update id, taking into account the wrap-around.

Parameters:
id1One of the update id's to check
id2One of the update id's to check
Returns:
The highest update id

The algorithm is specified in the ZigBee LightLink specification, section 8.6

void N_Util_StartTimerSafe ( uint8_t  taskId,
uint16_t  event,
uint16_t  timeoutMs 
)

Starts a timer. When it fails, it will assert.

Parameters:
taskIdThe task to send the timeout event to
eventThe timeout event to trigger
timeoutMsThe timeout in milliseconds
uint16_t N_Util_Random ( void  )

Return a random uint16_t. Not suitable for security-related code!!

uint32_t N_Util_TimerStart ( void  )

Start a stopwatch timer. After starting the timer, Util_TimerElapsed can be used to get the elapsed time

Returns:
The value that has to be supplied to Util_TimerElapsed to get the elapsed time
Note:
There is no stop function.
uint32_t N_Util_TimerElapsed ( uint32_t  startValue)

Get the elapsed time since the stopwatch timer was started

Parameters:
startValueThe value returned by Util_TimerStart
Returns:
The elapsed time in milliseconds since Util_TimerStart was called
Note:
The stopwatch timer uses timer 5 of the ATMega256R(4)FR2. This is a 16 bit timer.
uint16_t N_Util_GetMinimumStackLeft ( void  )

Return the minimum free stack space. Refers to the free space on External Stack.

Returns:
Free bytes on Stack or N_UTIL_STACK_CHECK_DISABLED on error.
uint16_t N_Util_GetCurrentStackLeft ( void  )

Returns how many bytes are available on stack. Refers to the free space on External Stack.

Returns:
Current free bytes on Stack or N_UTIL_STACK_CHECK_DISABLED on error.
void N_Util_Reboot ( N_Util_RebootMethod_t  method)

Reboot the system

Parameters:
methodReboot method that is required
